Static Private Attributes

Detailed Description

SerialCommunications encapsulated.

Will only work in linux (hopefully unix?) for now. Should maybe be superclassed with a *Comm-class.

Creates a new SerialComm object.

Open the port with openPort(..).

bool SerialComm::openPort (  const char *  device,
speed_t  speed,
bool  rtscts
) 
 

Open a serial port.

Parameters:
device The name of the serial device.
speed The speed in bps.
rtscts If this is true, use RTSCTS
Returns:
True if success.

bool SerialComm::openPort (  unsigned int  portnumber,
speed_t  speed,
bool  rtscts
) 
 

Open a serial port.

Parameters:
portnumber The number of the port to open. COM1=ttyS0=0
speed The speed in bps.
rtscts If this is true, use RTSCTS
Returns:
True if success.

int SerialComm::receive (  char *  buf,
int  bufsize,
uint32  micros
) 
 

Receive a maximum of bufsize characters from the open serial port.

Wait a maximum of micros usec, then return -1.

Parameters:
buf The buffer to put the result into.
bufsize The maximum number of chars to receive.
micros The maximum number of microseconds to wait. Wait forever if micros == 0
Returns:
The number of characters received.

int SerialComm::receive (  char *  buf,
int  bufsize
) 
 

Receive a maximum of bufsize characters from the serial port.

Parameters:
buf The buffer to put the result into.
bufsize The maximum number of characters to receive.
Returns:
The number of characters actually received.

int SerialComm::send (  const char *  buf,
int  numchars
) 
 

Send a string on the serial port.

Parameters:
buf The string to send.
numchars The number of chars to send.
Returns:
The number of chars actually sent. < 0 if an error occured.
